title: Ee Parakkum Thalika
descriptions:
Ee Parakkum Thalika (2001) is a Malayalam comedy centered on the misadventures of Unnikrishnan, a hapless young man who owns a dilapidated bus inherited from his late father. The bus, nicknamed Thamarakshan, is both his livelihood and his curse: constantly breaking down, attracting fines, and barely holding together with makeshift repairs. Unni’s loyal conductor-cum-friend Sundareshan stands by him through every mishap, from quarrels with traffic cops to irate passengers and scheming rivals who want the route permit.

Their chaotic routine is upended when Gayathri, a spirited young woman fleeing an oppressive home situation, secretly boards the bus and begins living inside it. Initially mistaking her for a troublemaker, Unni and Sundareshan soon discover her vulnerability and allow her to stay, setting off a string of comic misunderstandings as they hide her from authorities and nosy neighbors. Meanwhile, Unni’s nemesis—an overzealous police officer—tightens the noose with repeated inspections, and a local transporter plots to shut Unni down by sabotaging the bus.

As Unni and Gayathri grow close, the bus becomes a symbol of resilience and chosen family. Their quirky team—including a perpetually hungry cleaner and oddball regulars—rallies to save the vehicle when it faces seizure. After a climactic stretch of chases, slapstick mishaps, and clever ruses, Unni outwits his rivals, resolves Gayathri’s family troubles, and secures the permit that keeps his wheels turning. The film closes with the patched-up bus rolling on, Unni and Gayathri by each other’s side, celebrating hope, friendship, and the scrappy joy of keeping dreams alive against long odds.
